title: Why Not R
description: Why not use R for all courses in Commerce (BComm and MBA)?
contents:
It is my belief that a business studentâ€™s academic journey can be
enriched by using one computational system for the entire program,
whether it be for an undergrad or grad program. Here I make the case for
that system being R.
Let
me convince you!

title: Ordinal Regression
contents:
The purpose of this project is to show how to do an ordinal
regression in R.
Get
started!

title: Beta Regression
contents:
The purpose of this project is to show how to do a beta regression in
R using the awesome betareg package.
Get
started!

title: Greta and Causact
description: Bayesian Models with Greta and Causact
contents:
The purpose of this project is to illustrate how to use the causact library to build some simple
models. Causact allows you to create Bayesian models, and uses the greta library to do the
computations. Well, not really - greta just sets them up, and uses
TensorFlow underneath.
The cool thing is with causact you can describe your model as a
graph, like this: 
and it automatically generates the greta code which you can run to
get estimates of everything.
Get
started!
More stuff to come soon about:
- multilevel models
- priors
- posterior predictive distributions.

title: Ponies
contents:
A million years ago I did a series of posts about data science and
horse racing.
I cleaned it up a bit and migrated it from Wordpress to here.
You can still see the old version
for a while.
